title: Issues attempting to replay Gazebo log file

content.raw:
I am attempting to replay my log file for task 1 using the command described on the qual1 page:
```
gazebo -p ~/.gazebo/log/<timestamp>/gzserver/state.log
```

But I get the error
```
[FATAL] A ROS node for Gazebo has not been initialized, unable to load plugin. Load the Gazebo system plugin 'libgazebo_ros_api_plugin.so' in the gazebo_ros package)
```

I believe the command should be changed to read
```
rosrun gazebo_ros gazebo -p ~/.gazebo/log/<timestamp>/gzserver/state.log
```
while also having `roscore` running in another terminal.


However, this still does not allow me be play back my log file. When running the `gazebo_ros` command I listed above, I get the following terminal output:
```
[ INFO] Finished loading Gazebo ROS API Plugin.
[ INFO] waitForService: Service [/gazebo/set_physics_properties] has not been advertised, waiting...
[ INFO] waitForService: Service [/gazebo/set_physics_properties] is now available.
[ INFO] Physics dynamic reconfigure ready.
[ INFO] Camera Plugin (robotNamespace = /), Info: Using the 'robotNamespace' param: '/'
[ INFO] Camera Plugin (robotNamespace = /), Info: Using the 'robotNamespace' param: '/'
[ INFO] Camera Plugin (ns = /)  <tf_prefix_>, set to ""
[ INFO] Camera Plugin (ns = /)  <tf_prefix_>, set to ""
[ INFO] Laser Plugin (robotNamespace = /), Info: Using the 'robotNamespace' param: '/'
[ INFO] Starting GazeboRosLaser Plugin (ns = /)!
[ INFO] GPU Laser Plugin (ns = /) <tf_prefix_>, set to ""
[ INFO] LoadThread function completed
```
The Gazebo splash screen opens up, along with a Gazebo window to a black, empty world. I suspect that since my logfile is around 65MB, it is simply taking a long time to load. But after 1 hour, the program is in the same state (gzserver and gzclient are both using upwards of 90% memory throughout this time). So I am wondering if there is something else I need to be running in the background to play back the log file.

I am attempting to replay my log file for task 1 using the command described on the qual1 page:

gazebo -p ~/.gazebo/log/<timestamp>/gzserver/state.log

But I get the error

[FATAL] A ROS node for Gazebo has not been initialized, unable to load plugin. Load the Gazebo system plugin 'libgazebo_ros_api_plugin.so' in the gazebo_ros package)

I believe the command should be changed to read

rosrun gazebo_ros gazebo -p ~/.gazebo/log/<timestamp>/gzserver/state.log

while also having roscore running in another terminal.

However, this still does not allow me be play back my log file. When running the gazebo_ros command I listed above, I get the following terminal output:

[ INFO] Finished loading Gazebo ROS API Plugin.
[ INFO] waitForService: Service [/gazebo/set_physics_properties] has not been advertised, waiting...
[ INFO] waitForService: Service [/gazebo/set_physics_properties] is now available.
[ INFO] Physics dynamic reconfigure ready.
[ INFO] Camera Plugin (robotNamespace = /), Info: Using the 'robotNamespace' param: '/'
[ INFO] Camera Plugin (robotNamespace = /), Info: Using the 'robotNamespace' param: '/'
[ INFO] Camera Plugin (ns = /)  <tf_prefix_>, set to ""
[ INFO] Camera Plugin (ns = /)  <tf_prefix_>, set to ""
[ INFO] Laser Plugin (robotNamespace = /), Info: Using the 'robotNamespace' param: '/'
[ INFO] Starting GazeboRosLaser Plugin (ns = /)!
[ INFO] GPU Laser Plugin (ns = /) <tf_prefix_>, set to ""
[ INFO] LoadThread function completed

The Gazebo splash screen opens up, along with a Gazebo window to a black, empty world. I suspect that since my logfile is around 65MB, it is simply taking a long time to load. But after 1 hour, the program is in the same state (gzserver and gzclient are both using upwards of 90% memory throughout this time). So I am wondering if there is something else I need to be running in the background to play back the log file.
